solution_line_template: June has {june_days} days, so if they didn't play any songs on weekends, then they played {june_days} days - {weekend_days} days = <<{june_days}-{weekend_days}={active_days}>>{active_days} days.

If Vivian played {vivian_per_day} songs each day, the total number of songs she played for the month is {vivian_per_day} songs/day * {active_days} days = <<{vivian_per_day}*{active_days}={vivian_total}>>{vivian_total} songs.
Clara played {clara_fewer} fewer songs, which is {vivian_per_day} songs/day - {clara_fewer} songs/day = <<{vivian_per_day}-{clara_fewer}={clara_per_day}>>{clara_per_day} songs/day.
The total number of songs played by Clara for the whole month is {clara_per_day} songs/day * {active_days} days = <<{clara_per_day}*{active_days}={clara_total}>>{clara_total} songs.
The total played by both is {vivian_total} songs + {clara_total} songs = <<{vivian_total}+{clara_total}={total_songs}>>{total_songs} songs
